trans-unit.source: as alias for REAL or DOUBLE PRECISION

seg-source.mrk: as alias for REAL or DOUBLE PRECISION

target.mrk: as alias for REAL or DOUBLE PRECISION

trans-unit.source: The FLOAT data type is an alias for a REAL or DOUBLE PRECISION data type, depending on the precision you specify.

seg-source.mrk: The FLOAT data type is an alias for a REAL or DOUBLE PRECISION data type, depending on the precision you specify.

target.mrk: The FLOAT data type is an alias for a REAL or DOUBLE PRECISION data type, depending on the precision you specify.

trans-unit.source: The default precision for FLOAT is 53 and is equivalent to DOUBLE PRECISION. A precision of 23 or less makes FLOAT equivalent to REAL. A precision of 24 or greater makes FLOAT equivalent to DOUBLE PRECISION. If you specify a precision of 0, you get an error. If you specify a negative precision, you get a syntax error.

seg-source.mrk: The default precision for FLOAT is 53 and is equivalent to DOUBLE PRECISION.
A precision of 23 or less makes FLOAT equivalent to REAL.
A precision of 24 or greater makes FLOAT equivalent to DOUBLE PRECISION.
If you specify a precision of 0, you get an error.
If you specify a negative precision, you get a syntax error.

target.mrk: The default precision for FLOAT is 53 and is equivalent to DOUBLE PRECISION.
A precision of 23 or less makes FLOAT equivalent to REAL.
A precision of 24 or greater makes FLOAT equivalent to DOUBLE PRECISION.
If you specify a precision of 0, you get an error.
If you specify a negative precision, you get a syntax error.

trans-unit.source: If you are using a precision of 24 or greater, the limits of FLOAT are similar to the limits of DOUBLE.

seg-source.mrk: If you are using a precision of 24 or greater, the limits of FLOAT are similar to the limits of DOUBLE.

target.mrk: If you are using a precision of 24 or greater, the limits of FLOAT are similar to the limits of DOUBLE.

trans-unit.source: If you are using a precision of 23 or less, the limits of FLOAT are similar to the limits of REAL.

seg-source.mrk: If you are using a precision of 23 or less, the limits of FLOAT are similar to the limits of REAL.

target.mrk: If you are using a precision of 23 or less, the limits of FLOAT are similar to the limits of REAL.
